member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.EventArgsCache
member.summary: Provides a circular buffer of cached event argument classes to improve performance by reducing garbage collector workload.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.EventArgsCache.#ctor(System.Type,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes this cache with the specified number of empty event argument objects of the specified type.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.EventArgsCache.Next
member.summary: Gets the next event argument class from this cache.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit
member.summary: Provides a component for a Phidget Interface Kit device. The Phidget Interface Kit devices provide a combination of Digital Outputs, Digital Inputs and Analog Inputs. With this component, the programmer can: turn particular outputs on and off; get notified of changes of state of the inputs as events; configure events to fire when the analog inputs change;

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.IPhidgetComponent
member.summary: Interface for a component class that can wrap a phidget device.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.IPhidgetComponent.GetSkinType
member.summary: Gets a reference the type of a Windows Forms control class that implements a visual representation for this phidget.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.IPhidgetComponent.PhidgetDevice
member.summary: Gets/sets a reference to the wrapped phidget device.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.IPhidgetComponent.Attached
member.summary: Gets a flag that is true when this phidget component has been associated with a phidget device and that device is still attached to the computer.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Initializes this interface kit component not associated with any phidget device, and adds it to the given component container.
member.param: Container in which to add this component.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes this interface kit component not associated with any phidget device.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.GetSkinType
member.summary: Implements

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnAttach(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Attach event.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnDetach(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Detach event.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnInputChange(GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the InputChange event.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnOutputChange(GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the OutputChange event.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnSensorChange(GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the SensorChange event.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OnError(GroupLab.Phidgets.PhidgetErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.PhidgetDevice
member.summary: Gets/sets the wrapped phidget device.
member.remarks: The phidget device kind must be phidgetinterfacekit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Attached
member.summary: Gets a flag that when true indicates this phidget component has been associated with an underlying phidget device and that the device is attached to this computer.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Outputs
member.summary: Gets the collection of 's available on this interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Inputs
member.summary: Gets the collection of 's available on this interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Sensors
member.summary: Gets the collection of 's available on this interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AutoAttach
member.summary: Gets/sets a value that determines whether that the current interface kit component should automatically attach to an appropriate phidget device.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.FilterSerialNumbers
member.summary: Gets/sets the device serial numbers that are accepted by this interface kit component. If this list is empty the interface kit component will accept all device serial numbers.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Attach
member.summary: Occurs when this component has been associated with a phidget device.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Detach
member.summary: Occurs when the phidget device associated with this component has been detached from this computer.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.InputChange
member.summary: Occurs when a digital input value changes. The index of the particular digital input is returned, as well as the state of the input: True is On, False is Off. In the case of a switch (button) implementation, True would correspond to when the switch is pressed.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.OutputChange
member.summary: Occurs when a digital output value changes. The index of the particular output is returned, as well as the state of the output: True is On, False is Off. In the case of an LED implementation, True would correspond to the LED being turned on.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.SensorChange
member.summary: This event is triggered when an analog sensor's value is changed from the last reading by plus or minus the Sensitivity value. The index of the particular sensor is returned, as well as the sensor's value. By default, this value is a number between between 0 and 1000. However, different sensors may return values within a subset of that range i.e., there is no guarantee that the minimum or maximum value returned by a sensor is 0 or 1000.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.Error
member.summary: Occurs when there is a USB protocol error communicating with the phidget device.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalOutput
member.summary: Represents a digital output on an interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalOutput.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of this digital output.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalOutput.State
member.summary: Gets/sets the state of this digital output. In the case of an LED, True is on and False is off.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalOutputCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of digital outputs.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalOutputCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a digital output.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalInput
member.summary: Represents a digital input on an interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalInput.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of this input.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalInput.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of this input. In the case of a switch or button which is normally open, True would correspond to when the switch is pressed.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalInputCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of digital inputs on an interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.DigitalInputCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a digital input.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor
member.summary: Represents an analog sensor on an interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of this sensor.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.RawValue
member.summary: Returns the un-normalized value of the sensor between 0 - 1000. This is directly proportional to the Analog Input, ranging from 0-5V.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.NormalizeMinimum
member.summary: Gets/sets the lower bound on the sensor normalization range. This is usually 0, but if one sets it to a larger value e.g., 200, then the scale is adjusted so that the real range of 200 - 1000 are normalized to 0 - 1000. Actual readings less tahn this number are always reported as 0. There must be at lease a difference of 1 between this property and NormalizeMaximum

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.NormalizeMaximum
member.summary: Gets/sets the upper bound on the sensor normalization range. This is usually 1000, but if one sets it to a smaller value e.g., 700, then the scale is adjusted so that the real range of 0 - 700 are normalized to 0 - 1000. Actual readings greater than this number are always reported as 1000. There must be at lease a difference of 1 between this property and NormalizeMinimum

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets/sets the threshold (minimum difference between successive normalized sensor readings) for raising events.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensor.Value
member.summary: Returns the digital value being detected, converted to fit between 0-1000. The raw values within the range of NormalizeMaximum and NormalizeMinimum are normalized to 0 - 1000.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensorCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of analog sensors on an interface kit.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKit.AnalogSensorCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a sensor.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data associated with an interface kit phidget event.

member.name: F:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs.Index
member.summary: The digital input, analog sensor, or digital output that raised the event.

member.name: F:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs.State
member.summary: The new state of the digital input or digital output. This field's value is valid only for and events.

member.name: F:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs.Value
member.summary: The new value of the analog sensor. This field's value is valid only for events.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes this object with empty field values.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.InterfaceKitEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that can handle events raised by an interface kit phidget.

member.name: T:GroupLab.Phidgets.PhidgetManager
member.summary: The PhidgetManager provides a centralized mechanism for managing one or more Phidget USB devices. The PhidgetManager will notify an application through the event when new phidget devices are seen by the system (e.g., when a device is plugged in). When a phidget device is detached (e.g. by unplugging it) or otherwise lost to the system, the Detach event will fire. Note for previous Phidget Programmers: Each .NET Phidget Component has an instance to this static phidget manager and so you no longer need to use the PhidgetManager Attach event to hookup phidget devices. If you would like to revert to the old functionality set AutoAttach to false on your phidget components.

member.name: M:GroupLab.Phidgets.PhidgetManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PhidgetManager component instance.

member.summary: Initializes a new PhidgetManager component instance and adds it to the given component container.
member.param: Component container for the new PhidgetManager component instance.

member.summary: Overrides .
member.param: If this value is true the object will release unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Raises the Detach event.

member.summary: Occurs when a phidget device is detached from this computer.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.PhidgetManager.Error
member.summary: Occurs when the Phidget Manager is unable to communicate with the Phidget. This error is used when a call fails unexpected, typically when a device is detached but the OnDetach event has not yet been fired.

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.Servo.PositionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the servo motor is changing its position. Note: This even is raised as a side effect of programmatically setting the MotorPosition property i.e., it is the final resting position requested. Thus it may not match the actual current position of the actual motor (e.g., because of cascading requests as described in the MotorPosition property, or because the motor is still turning).

member.name: E:GroupLab.Phidgets.Servo.Error
member.summary: Occurs when there is a USB protocol error communicating with the phidget device.

member.summary: Gets the index of this motor.

member.name: P:GroupLab.Phidgets.Servo.Motor.Position
member.summary: Gets/sets the state of this motor. This value may range from 0 - 180, corresponding to degrees from the farthest counter-clockwise position.

member.summary: Represents a collection of digital outputs.
